newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil closes $3 a tonne higher on snowy weat.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil closes $3 a tonne higher on snowy weat.

text.p: IPE December gas oil ended the day $3 a tonne higher as the first flurries of snow in Europe coupled with a strong performance by New York heating oil gave the London market support, brokers said.
IPE gas oil closed at $221.50 a tonne and brokers expected further gains on expecations of cold weather in the U.S. northeast and the Midwest.
"Cold weather and the sight of snow in certain parts of Europe gave us some recovery but spreads weakened slightly and didn't allow it to run," a futures broker said.
"IPE gas oil was supported by heating oil and if the API numbers show a small draw in PADD 1 (east coast), then we will have a roofer," he added.

American Petroleum Institute data are due out later on Tuesday and the market is expecting to see a draw in distillates stocks, which include heating oil, because of last week's below normal temperature.
January Brent took heart from stronger gas oil and also firmed, trading 41 cents higher at 1834 GMT.
